clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Clinical Features of Autoimmune Hepatitis
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Clinical Features of Autoimmune Hepatitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the pathogenes, clinical characteristics, laboratory and histological examination results, treatment and prognosis of autoimmune hepatitis(AIH). At phase 1, the investigators focus on studying of the clinical characteristics of acute autoimmune hepatitis, and then will study the difference about treatment effects between acute autoimmune hepatitis and chronic AIH. Morever, the investigators have noticed that drug induced AIH have some special characteristics that may be beneficial to distinguish it with durg induced liver disease. Therefore the investigators will do some studies about drug induced AIH or other disease which maybe related to the onset of AIH.

detailed_description.textblock: Now this study has been researched at phase 1, the investigators focus on studying the difference between acute AIH and chronic AIH. In this phase, the investigators analysed the serum biochemical results such as ALT,AST,IgG,PT,INR and so on, and also compared the histological performance. Finally, we compared the percentages of biochemical remission in the two groups, and the time from initial treatment to biochemical remission has also been put into the analysis. Now, the investigators are preparing for submitting the manuscript of phase 1.

primary_outcome.description: This study is now in the phase 1, and the outcome at phase 1 is the biochemical remission of AIH patients. In details, if the participants' serum ALT,AST and IgG returned to normal, that means this participant reached the biochemical remission.

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed autoimmune hepatitis(AIH) are divided into acute cohort or chronic cohort by biochemical results, such as liver function and coagulation, then the investigators will compare the histological results, treatment effects and prognosis between the two groups. Further more, the investigators will study the pathogenesis of different forms of autoimmune hepatitis. Even more, the investigators want to explore drug induced AIH and viral hepatitis related AIH.

intervention.description: Comparing the pathogenesis,clinical characteristics and treatment effects between the acute autoimmune hepatitis group and the chronic autoimmune hepatitis group. The investigators don't use special intervention.

study_pop.textblock: Patients from the hospital outpatient or inpatient department, there is no geographical restrictions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of autoimmune hepatitis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other causes of liver disease, such as viral hepatitis, drug induced liver disease, primary biliary cirrhosis, primary sclerosing cholangitis, overlap syndrome and so on.
